overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, elizaos/eliza had 4 new PRs (4 merged), 1 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Bond Desk Agent
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
Check out the base trading agent we made for hackathon for this. Could be used potentially.

[https://github.com/wtfsayo/otaku](https://github.com/wtfsayo/otaku)

Probably using bond protocol infrastructure.

topIssues.title: Observability GUI for event runs
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Need this level of visibility/ui for event runs [https://content.trigger.dev/agent-parallelization.mp4](https://content.trigger.dev/agent-parallelization.mp4)

topIssues.title: Add Config Option for Discord Plugin to Only Respond to Mentions/Name Calls
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Introduce a configuration option in the Eliza Discord plugin so that the agent only responds when explicitly mentioned, or when directly called by its configured name.

topIssues.title: Imports not found in index.ts with Eliza CLI 1.61
topIssues.author: matteo-brandolino
topIssues.body:
## Describe the bug
When creating a new project using `elizaos create`, some imports in `index.ts` fail:
Module '"@Elizaos/core"' has no exported member 'logger'.ts(2305) Module '"@Elizaos/core"' has no exported member 'IAgentRuntime'.ts(2305) Module '"@Elizaos/core"' has no exported member 'ProjectAgent'.ts(2305)
Copy code

## To Reproduce
1. Install Eliza CLI 1.61.  
2. Run `elizaos create` to generate a new project.  
3. Open `index.ts` and try to import `logger`, `IAgentRuntime`, or `ProjectAgent` from `@Elizaos/core`.  

## Expected behavior
These members should be correctly exported and importable from `@Elizaos/core` in a newly generated project.  

## Screenshots
<!-- Add screenshots if applicable -->

## Additional context
- Eliza CLI version: 1.61  
- This occurs immediately after project creation without any modifications.  
- Possible regression from previous versions of `@Elizaos/core`.

topPRs.title: fix: code formatting standardization and const declaration fix
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code quality improvements through formatting standardization and a variable declaration fix.

## Changes

### Code Formatting
- **Quote Standardization**: Converted double quotes to single quotes across all client-side components for consistency
- **Formatting Consistency**: Applied consistent code formatting to:
  - Agent Prism components (Avatar, Badge, Button, CollapseAndExpandControls, etc.)
  - Trace viewer and span card components
  - Chat components
  - Configuration files (tsconfig.json, lerna.json)

### Bug Fix
- **Schema Transformer** (`packages/plugin-sql/src/runtime-migrator/schema-transformer.ts`):
  - Changed `let result` to `const result` on line 128
  - The variable is never reassigned after initialization, making it a good candidate for `const`
  - This follows best practices for immutable variable declarations

### Other Improvements
- Improved code readability through better line breaks and indentation
- Applied consistent formatting to CLI tests and server API code
- Reduced overall line count from 1385 to 1124 (-261 lines) through more efficient formatting

## Impact

- **No Functional Changes**: All changes are formatting-related except for the const fix
- **Improved Code Quality**: More consistent codebase following project style guidelines
- **Better Type Safety**: Using `const` instead of `let` for immutable variables

## Testing

- All existing tests should pass as no functional logic was changed
- The const fix is a minor improvement that doesn't affect runtime behavior

## Files Changed (42 files)

### Core Components
- `packages/cli/src/commands/start/index.ts`
- `packages/cli/tests/commands/dev.test.ts`
- `packages/cli/tests/commands/start.test.ts`

### Client Components (Agent Prism)
- 30+ component files in `packages/client/src/components/agent-prism/`
- Utility files: `agent-prism-utils.ts`, `eliza-span-adapter.ts`

### Plugin & Server
- `packages/plugin-sql/src/runtime-migrator/schema-transformer.ts`
- `packages/server/src/api/agents/runs.ts`

### Configuration
- `lerna.json`
- `tsconfig.json`

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Standardizes quotes/formatting across the client UI, tests, and configs, and replaces a let with const in the SQL schema transformer.
> 
> - **Client (agent-prism UI)**:
>   - Quote/style normalization and minor formatting across `packages/client/src/components/agent-prism/**` (no logic changes).
>   - Trace viewer, span card, tabs, and utilities (`agent-prism-utils.ts`, `eliza-span-adapter.ts`) reformatted.
> - **CLI Tests**:
>   - Formatting/line-wrap adjustments in `packages/cli/tests/commands/{dev,start}.test.ts`.
> - **Server**:
>   - Minor log string formatting in `packages/server/src/api/agents/runs.ts`.
> - **Plugin SQL**:
>   - In `packages/plugin-sql/src/runtime-migrator/schema-transformer.ts`, replace `let result` with `const result`.
> - **Config**:
>   - Compact arrays/formatting in `lerna.json` and `tsconfig.json`.
> - **Other**:
>   - Minor non-functional formatting in `packages/client/src/components/chat.tsx` and `agent-runs/AgentRunTimeline.tsx`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit fc94a1ce795f68129069b0ac6e0a2ca9eb94906b. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

>   - Testing/build: `@cypress/vite-dev-server`, `@testing-library/react`, `cypress`, `globals`, `jsdom`, `rollup-plugin-visualizer`, `vite`, `typescript` and `typescript-eslint`, `@vitejs/plugin-react-swc`, `eslint-import-resolver-typescript`.
>   - Types: `@types/react`.
> - **packages/core**:
>   - Runtime: `dotenv`, `langchain`, `uuid`.
>   - Dev tooling: `@types/uuid`, `prettier`, `typescript`.
> - **packages/server**:
>   - Runtime: `@sentry/node`, `@types/multer`, `dotenv`, `express-rate-limit`.
>   - Dev tooling: `prettier`, `tsx`, `which`.
> - **packages/api-client**:
>   - Dev tooling: `eslint`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 2523cc679c7a38ea7da4ad13b38a62e714965cd7. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>

topPRs.title: feat: Add mentionContext interface and improve shouldRespond logic
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

Issue discussing the need for platform-agnostic mention detection

# Risks

**Medium Risk**
- Changes core message flow logic in bootstrap
- Modifies shouldRespond template and provider
- Affects LLM decision-making for response behavior
- Impacts all platforms that depend on bootstrap logic

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR introduces a platform-agnostic mention detection system through the `MentionContext` interface:

**Core Changes:**
- Adds `MentionContext` interface to `Content` type in `packages/core/src/types/primitives.ts`
  - Provides universal structure for platform mention metadata (isMention, isReply, isThread)
  - Enables platforms to provide facts without implementing detection logic

- Enhances `shouldRespondTemplate` in `packages/core/src/prompts.ts`
  - Adds explicit "IMPORTANT RULES FOR RESPONDING" section
  - Clarifies "talking TO" vs "talking ABOUT" distinction
  - Instructs LLM to handle text mentions, typos, and variations naturally

- Enriches `shouldRespondProvider` in `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/shouldRespond.ts`
  - Adds 10+ examples covering edge cases (direct mentions, typos, indirect questions, references)
  - Teaches LLM to distinguish interpellation from mere references

- Modifies `shouldBypassShouldRespond` in `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/index.ts`
  - Accepts optional `mentionContext` parameter
  - Implements fast-path optimization: skips LLM call for platform-native mentions (@mentions, replies)
  - Saves tokens and improves response time for obvious mentions

**Key Architecture Principles:**
- Bootstrap remains 100% platform-agnostic (no Discord/Telegram/etc specific logic)
- Platforms provide FACTS only via mentionContext
- LLM analyzes context and makes intelligent decisions
- Fast path for platform mentions, LLM path for text analysis

## What kind of change is this?

- [x] Features (adds platform-agnostic MentionContext interface)
- [x] Improvements (refactors mention detection to be more intelligent and extensible)

# Documentation changes needed?

- [x] My changes require a change to the project documentation
- Documentation needed for:
  - `MentionContext` interface usage guide for plugin developers
  - How platforms should populate mentionContext metadata
  - Fast-path optimization behavior explanation

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. Review the `MentionContext` interface in `packages/core/src/types/primitives.ts`
2. Check the enhanced prompt in `packages/core/src/prompts.ts` (search for "IMPORTANT RULES FOR RESPONDING")
3. Review enriched examples in `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/shouldRespond.ts`
4. Check `shouldBypassShouldRespond` changes in `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/index.ts`
5. Run test suites to verify coverage

## Detailed testing steps

**Automated Tests:**

```bash
# Core prompts tests (8 tests)
bun test packages/core/src/__tests__/prompts.test.ts

# Bootstrap logic tests (21 tests, 6 new for mentionContext)
bun test packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/__tests__/logic.test.ts
```

**Test Coverage:**
- ✅ `packages/core/src/__tests__/prompts.test.ts`
  - Verifies shouldRespondTemplate contains new "IMPORTANT RULES FOR RESPONDING" section
  - Checks for "talking TO" vs "talking ABOUT" instructions
  - **Result: 8 pass, 0 fail**

- ✅ `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/__tests__/logic.test.ts`
  - New describe block: "shouldBypassShouldRespond with mentionContext"
  - 6 new tests covering:
    1. DM channel bypass
    2. Platform mention bypass (isMention=true)
    3. Reply to bot bypass (isReply=true)
    4. No bypass for regular messages
    5. client_chat source bypass
    6. Platform agnostic behavior (discord, telegram, twitter, slack)
  - **Result: 21 pass, 0 fail**

**Manual Integration Testing:**
- Platforms implementing mentionContext will need to test with real messages
- Verify LLM correctly distinguishes "Hey BotName, help me" (RESPOND) vs "BotName's code is great" (IGNORE)
- Verify fast-path works for @mentions (no unnecessary LLM calls)

## Screenshots

N/A - This is core infrastructure with no UI changes

# Deploy Notes

## Deployment instructions

**Standard deployment:**
1. Merge this PR to main
2. Release as v1.6.2 (or next minor version)
3. No breaking changes - fully backward compatible
4. Platforms can adopt mentionContext incrementally (optional parameter)

**For platform plugin developers:**
- Existing plugins continue to work without changes
- To adopt mentionContext, populate it in message content before passing to bootstrap
- Reference Discord plugin implementation as example

**No database changes required**

topPRs.title: fix: register and export shouldRespondProvider in bootstrap plugin
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

Fixes missing shouldRespondProvider registration in bootstrap plugin

# Risks

Low. This change restores functionality that was accidentally removed. It only affects the shouldRespond logic in the bootstrap plugin by properly registering and exporting the provider.

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR registers and exports the `shouldRespondProvider` in the bootstrap plugin, which was previously defined but not registered in the plugin's providers array or exported from the providers index.

## What kind of change is this?

Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

Check that the `shouldRespondProvider` is:
1. Exported in `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/index.ts`
2. Registered in the providers array in `packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/index.ts`

## Detailed testing steps

- Verify the bootstrap plugin builds successfully
- Confirm that the shouldRespond logic now executes when processing messages
- Test that the agent properly evaluates whether to respond based on message context

# Deploy Notes

None. This is a straightforward bug fix that restores missing provider registration.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Registers and exports shouldRespondProvider in the bootstrap plugin, tweaks its example text assembly, and enables noEmit in tsconfig.
> 
> - **Plugin Bootstrap**:
>   - **Providers**: Register `shouldRespondProvider` in `src/index.ts` and export it from `src/providers/index.ts`.
>   - **shouldRespond**: Minor refactor to assemble examples (`examplesText`) before adding header.
> - **Build/Config**:
>   - `tsconfig.json`: Enable `"noEmit": true`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit d1d611d765372b13e8c383e0721bbccc895e366a. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
